item.title: Black bearded irises bloom just in time for Halloween
item.description: While red roses have their moment on Valentine's Day, these "black suited" irises come into bloom close to Halloween.

item.title: Darling Downs 'inundated' with reports of snakes, bites and near misses
item.description: Gunter Glasser has been catching snakes for almost 30 years across Southern Queensland, but October has been an especially busy month.

item.title: Australia's Jillaroos lose Tamika Upton for Pacific Championships Test against New Zealand's Kiwi Ferns
item.description: The Jillaroos will have to cope without one of their stars in Sunday's Pacific Championships Test against New Zealand in Auckland.

item.title: Strong prices, good conditions encourage Queensland farmers to trial canola
item.description: While they are a long way off from rivalling the plantings in Western Australia or New South Wales, growers in Queensland are experimenting with canola and reaping the rewards.

item.title: Yacht salvage team innovates with geotextile to protect Lady Elliot Island reef
item.description: After a fibreglass yacht ran aground on Lady Elliot Island's pristine reef, a bespoke salvage team worked tirelessly to save the environment from irreparable harm.

item.title: World War II bomb blast shakes Solomon Islands capital Honiara, injuring one
item.description: Police say a large explosion that rocked the capital overnight was caused by a World War II bomb.

item.title: Man removes 18km of barbed wire fencing from Victorian property to save wildlife
item.description: Wongarra man Doug Gimesy removes more than 18 kilometres of barbed wire from his property to create a wildlife haven.

item.title: Isla Bell's alleged murderer Marat Ganiev and co-accused Eyal Yaffe ordered to stand trial
item.description: A judge rules there is enough evidence to send Marat Ganiev and co-accused Eyal Yaffe to trial over the death of the 19-year-old, whose body was found at a tip in Melbourne's south-east last year.

item.title: Commissioner to hear submissions why Vlassakis should not be released on parole
item.description: The South Australian Parole Administrative Review Commissioner will start hearing submissions in December as to why Snowtown killer James Vlassakis should not be released on parole.

item.title: Opposition implies Labor scuttled Sussan Ley's planned visit to Tomago smelter
item.description: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley has revealed her scheduled tour of the plant was cancelled at the last minute but she was given a meeting with its chief executive.

item.title: Disgraced ex-Kiama MP Gareth Ward sentenced for sexually abusing two young men
item.description: Former New South Wales Liberal minister and independent Kiama MP, Gareth Ward, is sentenced to five years and nine months in jail for sexually abusing two young men.

item.title: GWS Giants player Katherine Smith on playing AFLW through pain of endometriosis
item.description: Endometriosis remains a silent struggle for many women and elite athletes alike. GWS Giants leader Katherine Smith spent years playing through the pain.

item.title: Queensland Health confirms homemade food products as source of rat poisoning cluster
item.description: Queensland Health says the three products were made in a home kitchen and were either gifted or purchased in the local area.

item.title: Perth men charged over seizure of more than five tonnes of illicit cigarettes, vapes and loose tobacco
item.description: Two Perth brothers are charged after the seizure of more than four million cigarettes, around 50,500 vapes and almost 900 kilograms of loose-leaf tobacco.

item.title: International stars and everyday Australians pay tribute to cricketer Ben Austin
item.description: Cricketers at the highest levels of the sport have paid tribute to 17-year-old Ben Austin who died on Thursday after being struck by a ball at a training session.

item.title: What are the origins of Andrew Mountbatten Windsor's name?
item.description: Buckingham Palace has announced Prince Andrew will lose his royal titles and honours. But where does his surname Mountbatten Windsor come from?

item.title: Waroona Shire suggests blowing up rotting whale carcass to save money
item.description: A coastal shire in WA suggests towing a rotting whale carcass out to sea and blowing it up, saying it cannot afford to dispose of the whale itself.

item.title: Canberra man sentenced for emptying friend's bank account while victim was recovering in hospital
item.description: After a severe car accident, the victim spent a year recovering in hospital. Then one day he discovered his bank account was empty.

item.title: Will Hayward and Ollie Florent left hurt by brutal conversation with Sydney before Carlton trades
item.description: Will Hayward and Ollie Florent were both locked into long-term deals with Sydney before being told they needed to leave while holidaying in South America.

item.title: Aboriginal Community Controlled Health Service clinics in remote NT desperately need additional resources
item.description: Imagine visiting a health clinic where you may be exposed to asbestos, leaking roofs and lead in the water pipes. That's the reality for remote NT, according to a new report.

item.title: Stripped of his titles and his home, Andrew's humiliation is complete
item.description: Once considered the darling of the royal family and the "favourite" son of Queen Elizabeth II, the King's brother will now be known only as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor. It's a humiliation for the history books.

item.title: Rescuers scramble to recover bodies after landslide in Papua New Guinea
item.description: Police say 21 people have been killed in a landslide in Papua New Guinea's highlands overnight, with bodies still being recovered.

item.title: Queensland mayors to lead local disaster recovery after long-running dispute at Ipswich City Council
item.description: The changes form part of a larger Empowering Councils Bill set to be introduced by the Queensland government later this year.

item.title: High Country killer Greg Lynn faces court in bid to quash Carol Clay murder conviction
item.description: Greg Lynn's lawyer says the prosecution "played outside the rules" during the former Jetstar pilot's double-murder trial last year as he appeals his conviction and sentence.

item.title: Port Adelaide dismisses Warren Tredrea from board of directors
item.description: AFL great Warren Tredrea has been dismissed from the board of the Port Adelaide Football Club, the Power has confirmed.

item.title: Broncos legend Corey Parker fears Reece Walsh's stardom may mean eventual code switch
item.description: After setting the NRL and international rugby league alight in recent months, Reece Walsh's next move could be one that leads him to global stardom.

item.title: What happens to Prince Andrew's children? Princess Beatrice and Eugenie to keep their titles
item.description: What to know about the future of Andrew Mountbatten Windsor's daughters and their role in the royal family going forward.

item.title: Jury finds man guilty of rape of woman he found unconscious on Shepparton nature strip
item.description: A jury has found a 29-year-old Vanuatu national guilty of the rape and abduction of a woman in Shepparton in August last year.

item.title: What moving overseas for love and work looked like for Alex
item.description: Having recently ended a seven-year long-distance relationship, Alex Bowyer wasn't keen on repeating history when he met his now-boyfriend Tony in Japan. So he packed up his life and moved overseas — but not without a safety net.

item.title: Hundreds of jobs to go as AGL speeds up energy transition
item.description: AGL is preparing to shed hundreds jobs as part of a massive restructure aimed at freeing up capital to accelerate its transition away from coal and towards renewables.

item.title: Liberals hope for climate consensus but fear Nationals will dump net zero first
item.description: After most federal Liberal MPs attended a net zero meeting in Canberra, there is cautious optimism a consensus position can be found, but the junior Coalition partner could be poised to strike first.

item.title: Encrypted police group chat stops case against Canberra Raiders star Josh Papalii
item.description: Charges against Canberra Raiders prop Josh Papalii have been permanently stayed after it was revealed police had been discussing the case in a group chat on encrypted messaging service Signal.

item.title: Queensland teachers reject state government pay offer
item.description: Queensland Teachers' Union members vote against an offer of an 8 per cent pay rise, vowing to keep up their campaign for better wages and working conditions.

item.title: NT government should proceed with Darwin ship lift project despite cost blowout, report finds
item.description: The NT government will gain no direct revenue from the ship lift project, despite spending $820 million on its construction.

item.title: Bureau of Meteorology reverts to previous rain radar after wave of complaints
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says it will revert to its previous colour scheme on its rain radar and weather map following a wave of complaints about its new $4.1 million website.

item.title: Miners asked to reconsider using industrial explosives involved in underground explosion which killed two
item.description: Regulator may ban the type of explosive used in fatal mining accident which claimed the lives of two workers.

item.title: In pictures: Andrew's journey from favourite son to outcast prince
item.description: Prince Andrew has been stripped of his royal titles and removed from the Royal Lodge. Here's a photographic timeline of his scandalous downfall.

item.title: Report shows gender pay gap increases for women as they age
item.description: At the start of their careers, men and women earn almost the same. But by the time women reach their 30s their earnings flatten, while men's climb.

item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology issues a "very dangerous" thunderstorm warning for parts of south-east Queensland, with residents urged to prepare for supercell storms.

item.title: What do we know about Sandringham and Prince Andrew's new home?
item.description: The disgraced royal will be moving to a house somewhere on the sprawling Sandringham Estate owned by King Charles — but the exact location has not been made public.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne happy to open in Australia's Test side for upcoming Ashes series
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne is prepared to do whatever it takes to get back into Australia's Test side, even if that means batting in a non-preferred opening slot.

item.title: Friday Finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Australia vs India second T20: Hazlewood and Marsh dominate in Melbourne
item.description: A lethal spell from Josh Hazlewood has propelled Australia to an emphatic four-wicket Twenty20 win over India in front of 82,438 fans at the MCG.

item.title: Australian climber dies on Nepal's Himlung Himal
item.description: An Australian mountaineer dies while descending one of Nepal's highest peaks.

item.title: Report details 'extreme risk' tied to Parramatta's Riverside Theatres redevelopment
item.description: The redevelopment of Parramatta's Riverside Theatres is part of a plan to revitalise the CBD and turn it into a buzzing arts and cultural precinct.

item.title: WA man fined over neglect of two dogs which 'suffered greatly'
item.description: A man in Western Australia's far north has been fined and banned from owning pets for five years after being found guilty of neglecting two dogs.

item.title: NACC chief Paul Brereton steps away from all defence investigations
item.description: The head of the National Anti-Corruption Commission will step away from all defence-related corruption referrals following questions over his handling of perceived conflicts of interest.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa death toll continues rising as Caribbean nations embark on clean-up
item.description: The death toll in the wake of Hurricane Melissa has climbed to at least 49, according to official reports, after wreaking destruction across much of the northern Caribbean.

item.title: Dutch centrist leader Rob Jetten claims election victory and is set to become country's youngest PM
item.description: Dutch centrist party D66 is now expected to take the lead in a first round of talks to form a coalition government.

item.title: Albanese's salad days are stalked by the spectres of stagflation and soaring bills
item.description: The PM and his government are sitting in the often-fleeting sweet spot that comes early in the second term under our Westminster system of government.

item.title: The mystery of Prince Andrew's finances and why there are calls for more transparency
item.description: Andrew remains the subject of a mystery many are flummoxed by. The king's brother has not had a paid job for large chunks of his life, yet somehow he has managed to fund a luxury lifestyle.

item.title: What does the average house price get you in regional Victoria?
item.description: The median house price in regional Victoria is $636,500. But what that will get you can look very different from place to place.

item.title: Prince Andrew's downfall is Virginia Giuffre's justice, but can it save the monarchy?
item.description: Prince Andrew has been exiled to a kind royal house arrest but the jury is still out on whether it's enough to stem damage to the monarchy.

item.title: Older Australians say new aged care reforms will make them 'feel more imprisoned' after change in fees
item.description: Older Australians were promised "a world class aged care system", but as "once in a generation" changes roll out, some feel they are being delivered anything but.

item.title: Conjoined twins in PNG could be sent to Germany for surgery after Australia hopes fall through
item.description: The parents of conjoined twins in PNG who were hoping to send their babies to Sydney for an operation are now trying to go to Germany instead because Australia is too expensive

item.title: Zohran Mamdani's pledge to arrest Benjamin Netanyahu in NYC 'unenforceable campaign promise'
item.description: Zohran Mamdani, the man many predict will become New York City's next mayor, has made plenty of promises — his one to arrest Israel's PM is causing a particular stir ahead of Tuesday's election.
